options.title: -x, --extended
options.description:
Extended-search mode. Since 0.10.9, this is enabled by default. You can
      disable it with +x or --no-extended.

options.title: -x, --extended
options.description:
Extended-search mode. Since 0.10.9, this is enabled by default. You can
      disable it with +x or --no-extended.

options.title: -e, --exact
options.description: Enable exact-match

options.title: -e, --exact
options.description: Enable exact-match

options.title: -i
options.description: Case-insensitive match (default: smart-case match)

options.title: --literal
options.description: Do not normalize latin script letters for matching.

options.title: --algo=TYPE
options.description:
Fuzzy matching algorithm (default: v2)
    v2 Optimal scoring algorithm (quality)
      
      v1 Faster but not guaranteed to find the optimal result
        (performance)

options.title:
-n,
    --nth=N[,..]
options.description:
Comma-separated list of field index expressions for limiting search scope.
      See FIELD INDEX EXPRESSION for the details.

options.title:
-n,
    --nth=N[,..]
options.description:
Comma-separated list of field index expressions for limiting search scope.
      See FIELD INDEX EXPRESSION for the details.

options.title: --with-nth=N[,..]
options.description: Transform the presentation of each line using field index expressions

options.title:
-d,
    --delimiter=STR
options.description:
Field delimiter regex for --nth and --with-nth (default:
      AWK-style)

options.title:
-d,
    --delimiter=STR
options.description:
Field delimiter regex for --nth and --with-nth (default:
      AWK-style)

options.title: --disabled
options.description:
Do not perform search. With this option, fzf becomes a simple selector
      interface rather than a "fuzzy finder". You can later enable the
      search using enable-search or toggle-search action.

options.title: +s, --no-sort
options.description: Do not sort the result

options.title: --tac
options.description: Reverse the order of the input

options.title: --tiebreak=CRI[,..]
options.description:
Comma-separated list of sort criteria to apply when the scores are tied.
    length Prefers line with shorter length
      
      begin Prefers line with matched substring closer to the beginning
      
      end Prefers line with matched substring closer to the end
      
      index Prefers line that appeared earlier in the input stream
    - Each criterion should appear only once in the list
      
      - index is only allowed at the end of the list
      
      - index is implicitly appended to the list when not specified
      
      - Default is length (or equivalently length,index)
      
      - If end is found in the list, fzf will scan each line
      backwards

options.title: -m, --multi
options.description:
Enable multi-select with tab/shift-tab. It optionally takes an integer
      argument which denotes the maximum number of items that can be
    selected.

options.title: -m, --multi
options.description:
Enable multi-select with tab/shift-tab. It optionally takes an integer
      argument which denotes the maximum number of items that can be
    selected.

options.title: +m, --no-multi
options.description: Disable multi-select

options.title: --no-mouse
options.description: Disable mouse

options.title: --bind=KEYBINDS
options.description:
Comma-separated list of custom key bindings. See KEY/EVENT BINDINGS
      for the details.

options.title: --cycle
options.description: Enable cyclic scroll

options.title: --keep-right
options.description:
Keep the right end of the line visible when it's too long. Effective only
      when the query string is empty.

options.title: --no-hscroll
options.description: Disable horizontal scroll

options.title: --hscroll-off=COL
options.description:
Number of screen columns to keep to the right of the highlighted substring
      (default: 10). Setting it to a large value will cause the text to be
      positioned on the center of the screen.

options.title: --filepath-word
options.description:
Make word-wise movements and actions respect path separators. The
      following actions are affected:
    backward-kill-word
      
      backward-word
      
      forward-word
      
      kill-word

options.title: --jump-labels=CHARS
options.description: Label characters for jump and jump-accept

options.title: --height=HEIGHT[%]
options.description:
Display fzf window below the cursor with the given height instead of using
      the full screen.

options.title: --min-height=HEIGHT
options.description:
Minimum height when --height is given in percent (default: 10).
      Ignored when --height is not specified.

options.title: --layout=LAYOUT
options.description:
Choose the layout (default: default)
    default Display from the bottom of the screen
      
      reverse Display from the top of the screen
      
      reverse-list Display from the top of the screen, prompt at the
        bottom

options.title: --reverse
options.description: A synonym for --layout=reverse

options.title: --border[=STYLE]
options.description:
Draw border around the finder
    rounded Border with rounded corners (default)
      
      sharp Border with sharp corners
      
      horizontal Horizontal lines above and below the finder
      
      vertical Vertical lines on each side of the finder
      
      top
      
      bottom
      
      left
      
      right
      
      none

options.title: --no-unicode
options.description:
Use ASCII characters instead of Unicode box drawing characters to draw
      border

options.title: --margin=MARGIN
options.description: Comma-separated expression for margins around the finder.

options.title: --padding=PADDING
options.description:
Comma-separated expression for padding inside the border. Padding is
      distinguishable from margin only when --border option is used.
    e.g.
      
       fzf --margin 5% --padding 5% --border --preview 'cat {}' \
      
       --color bg:#222222,preview-bg:#333333

options.title: --info=STYLE
options.description:
Determines the display style of finder info.
    default Display on the next line to the prompt
      
      inline Display on the same line
      
      hidden Do not display finder info

options.title: --no-info
options.description: A synonym for --info=hidden

options.title: --prompt=STR
options.description: Input prompt (default: '> ')

options.title: --pointer=STR
options.description: Pointer to the current line (default: '>')

options.title: --marker=STR
options.description: Multi-select marker (default: '>')

options.title: --header=STR
options.description:
The given string will be printed as the sticky header. The lines are
      displayed in the given order from top to bottom regardless of
      --layout option, and are not affected by --with-nth. ANSI
      color codes are processed even when --ansi is not set.

options.title: --header-lines=N
options.description:
The first N lines of the input are treated as the sticky header. When
      --with-nth is set, the lines are transformed just like the other
      lines that follow.

options.title: --ansi
options.description: Enable processing of ANSI color codes

options.title: --tabstop=SPACES
options.description: Number of spaces for a tab character (default: 8)

options.title: --color=[BASE_SCHEME][,COLOR_NAME[:ANSI_COLOR][:ANSI_ATTRIBUTES]]...
options.description:
Color configuration. The name of the base color scheme is followed by
      custom color mappings.

options.title: --no-bold
options.description: Do not use bold text

options.title: --black
options.description: Use black background

options.title: --history=HISTORY_FILE
options.description:
Load search history from the specified file and update the file on
      completion. When enabled, CTRL-N and CTRL-P are
      automatically remapped to next-history and
    previous-history.

options.title: --history-size=N
options.description:
Maximum number of entries in the history file (default: 1000). The file is
      automatically truncated when the number of the lines exceeds the
    value.

options.title: --preview=COMMAND
options.description:
Execute the given command for the current line and display the result on
      the preview window. {} in the command is the placeholder that is
      replaced to the single-quoted string of the current line. To transform the
      replacement string, specify field index expressions between the braces
      (See FIELD INDEX EXPRESSION for the details).

options.title:
-q,
    --query=STR
options.description: Start the finder with the given query

options.title:
-q,
    --query=STR
options.description: Start the finder with the given query

options.title: -1, --select-1
options.description:
If there is only one match for the initial query (--query), do not
      start interactive finder and automatically select the only match

options.title: -1, --select-1
options.description:
If there is only one match for the initial query (--query), do not
      start interactive finder and automatically select the only match

options.title: -0, --exit-0
options.description:
If there is no match for the initial query (--query), do not start
      interactive finder and exit immediately

options.title: -0, --exit-0
options.description:
If there is no match for the initial query (--query), do not start
      interactive finder and exit immediately

options.title:
-f,
    --filter=STR
options.description:
Filter mode. Do not start interactive finder. When used with
      --no-sort, fzf becomes a fuzzy-version of grep.

options.title:
-f,
    --filter=STR
options.description:
Filter mode. Do not start interactive finder. When used with
      --no-sort, fzf becomes a fuzzy-version of grep.

options.title: --print-query
options.description: Print query as the first line

options.title: --expect=KEY[,..]
options.description:
Comma-separated list of keys that can be used to complete fzf in addition
      to the default enter key. When this option is set, fzf will print the name
      of the key pressed as the first line of its output (or as the second line
      if --print-query is also used). The line will be empty if fzf is
      completed with the default enter key. If --expect option is
      specified multiple times, fzf will expect the union of the keys.
      --no-expect will clear the list.

options.title: --read0
options.description:
Read input delimited by ASCII NUL characters instead of newline
    characters

options.title: --print0
options.description:
Print output delimited by ASCII NUL characters instead of newline
      characters

options.title: --no-clear
options.description:
Do not clear finder interface on exit. If fzf was started in full screen
      mode, it will not switch back to the original screen, so you'll have to
      manually run tput rmcup to return. This option can be used to avoid
      flickering of the screen when your application needs to start fzf multiple
      times in order.

options.title: --sync
options.description:
Synchronous search for multi-staged filtering. If specified, fzf will
      launch ncurses finder only after the input stream is complete.

options.title: --version
options.description: Display version information and exit
